etymology.description: Pictogram (象形): various interpretations—e.g., a man bending to sow, a clan emblem on a stick, the root of a tree, a spoon/mallet; in bronze forms a dot inside the vertical stroke later became a horizontal 一 and the vertical stroke curved.
etymology.interpretation: A schematic mark or figure associated with lineage, hence the meanings ‘clan; family name’. Over time, scribal changes converted the inner dot to a short horizontal and rounded the main stroke, yielding the modern shape.

examples.chinese: 在族谱中，他被记为李氏(在族譜中，他被記為李氏)。
examples.pinyin: Zài zúpǔ zhōng, tā bèi jì wéi Lǐshì.
examples.english: In the genealogy, he is recorded as of the Li clan.

examples.chinese: 考古报告提到出土木简上写有“某氏”(考古報告提到出土木簡上寫有「某氏」)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔ bàogào tí dào chūtǔ mùjiǎn shang xiě yǒu “mǒu shì”.
examples.english: An archaeological report mentions wooden slips inscribed with “a certain clan.”

examples.chinese: 古代区分姓与氏，姓为本，氏为支(古代區分姓與氏，姓為本，氏為支)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài qūfēn xìng yǔ shì, xìng wéi běn, shì wéi zhī.
examples.english: In antiquity, xìng and shì were distinguished: xìng was the root lineage, shì the branch.
